awd_titl_txt: Workshop at ICSI:  On Randomized Algorithms and Computation, December 17-22, l995, Berkeley, California
awd_abstract_narration: 9531794  Luby  This project funds speaker and participant costs for a workshop,  titled ``Randomized Algorithms and Computation'', at ICSI,  December 17 -- 22, 1995.   The Workshop emphasizes applications  to approximation algorithms for optimization and counting  problems, coding theory with network and multimedia applications,  cryptography and security, distributed computation, and  derandomization of algorithms.    The Workshop:            (1) Brings together leading researchers from Europe,  Israel, Canada and the U.S.;          (2) Is being combined with the Weizmann Institute  Workshop on ``Randomness and Computation'' (normally  held in Israel in January);          (3) Is organized in cooperation with the ESPIRT RAND  Working Group.    This project is a cooperative funding effort with support for  European participants provided by the ESPRIT RAND-REC Project.  ***
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
